website_summaries.verdict: This versatile remote control offers many features, including several modes for your ceiling fan and light.
pros: Conveniently arranged buttons that are easy to reach with the thumb
We love how setting up the connectivity is quick and simple with the appropriate fan
cons: Limited use since compatibility is only with Hampton Bay and Harbor Breeze fans

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: The hardest thing about replacing the receiver on my Harbor Breeze ceiling fan/light was not being sure if the original receiver was broken, rather than something else. So I was glad to see that this kit includes a remote transmitter as well as a receiver. The kit arrived very quickly. The new receiver's measurements and layout are identical to the old one's, so installation was not a problem. And I was glad to see that the fan and light are fully functional again. As it turns out, the old remote transmitter still works, so now we have two.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly! Made a difference in our marriage!
customer_reviews.text: We love our fan remote! We set it for an hour or two at night, so that my husband can fall asleep in a cool room. It turns the fan off after we are asleep, so that I don't wake up in the middle of the night having to turn it off manually. I can get an uninterrupted full night sleep. Love it! (We don't have a need to use it for our light, so just use it for our fan.) We bought one for our bedroom and one for our guest room. They work perfectly! We had an electrician install them as we are not handy at all with that kind of thing.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: I wish it kept working.
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY liked this when I first got it. I loved the convenience of the remote for the fan and light. I even thought the automatic fan setting was cool. And the delay function for going to bed also great. Unfortunately, after several months, I started having trouble getting the light to go off...then go on. And sometimes turning light off, turned the fan off. So, now at this point, I have no remote and operate it by the switch.
customer_reviews.author: globaltech

customer_reviews.title: Won't buy again dead in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even last 2 full months than dried out. Standard 3 speed fan with light. Worked fine than had a bad light flicker and didn't come on after that. Won't buy again. Photos show the results after taking it out ... fan works fine without it and had power too and into device.
customer_reviews.author: carl young

customer_reviews.title: NOT Hampton Bay remote as shown in description
customer_reviews.text: Not honest description. They show a instruction graphic that clearly says "Hampton Bay". It is NOT a Hampton Bay. Doesn't even look like a HB. It says "Flow Angel". I'll install it. But they should be called out for being dishonest and should be reported to HB for false use of TM. UPDATE: No, I will not be installing this unit. I am returning for refund. I looked at the 1 star complaints and clearly this unit is junk. It's hard enough to install the receiver let alone needing to do it again in two months.
customer_reviews.author: Carter West

customer_reviews.title: Even better then the first!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product from same seller several years ago. Back then each press of the fan button resulted in an audible click sound. Lasted 3 years of everyday use, at least 5 times a day use too. Was going fine till we had a lightning strike which took out some electronics in house. Love how well the new one works, absolutely silent when fan switches “gears”.
customer_reviews.author: Azimuth

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than some, but better features
customer_reviews.text: This is bigger than some add on remotes, but it has a feature I love. You can set the fan to automatically slow down as the temperature drops. This is perfect in the bedroom. I bought one of these about 15 years ago and it still works. This newer model is a bit smaller. The transceiver that goes in the canopy is a tad large, but you can make it it.
customer_reviews.author: BLD

customer_reviews.title: Led compatible!!
customer_reviews.text: Works with LEDs. Had one of these a long time ago. It worked great until the world moved to LEDs. Bought this one with some people saying it did and some saying it didn't work with LEDs. Love the thermostat function. Fan speeds up as room gets warms and slows down as it gets colder. No more getting up on summer nights to turn fan down.
customer_reviews.author: DIYPowerUp

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for original failed receiver, bonus controller also!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy replacement of my original old unit which failed after 5 years. I love the convenience of setting an auto temp, and it keeps the living room comfortable during our Houston summers paired with the air conditioner, of course. When I first bought the ceiling fan, it became quickly apparent that this unit would NEVER fit inside the fan base with all the wires, etc. In order to not leave an eyesore in view hanging out the side of the mount, I spliced the unit in-line in the romex in my attic that feeds from the switch to the fan. Out of sight and works like a charm! Made replacement super simple. Done in 3 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Z. MACKAY

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: More functional remote for less money than the standard basic one it replaced. Easy to install. The only two things that are a minor negative are the clicking in the fan when the speed changes and the remote is not snug in the holder. The latter I can fix by putting some foam or something to make it more snug. So far it is working well. Mine came with the Hampton Bay logo on the remote. So at least I know they are made for name brand companies.
customer_reviews.author: Retief

customer_reviews.title: Great add on remote, simple to install, nice to use!
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on an older Hunter ceiling fan that was never designed to have a remote (there is a slide in slot on the ones I've seen that do). It was really easy to install and a fair bit of space so it wasn't cramped. Works great! Nice to have a dimming feature on the lights and temperature control is what we are really looking for as we have a larger house and need the automatic control to help destratify the air. Highly recommend it to setup full remote on your fan. Note that it can't control the fan direction, you'll need to flip the switch as the season changes.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Welch

customer_reviews.title: The display is lit up and seems like it is functioning
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit to try to add remote function to ceiling fan in my daughter's bedroom, but I couldn't get the receiver to fit in the fan housing. The remote does work with the Hampton Bay ceiling fan in master bedroom (already had a remote receiver). My only complaint about the remote is that the battery door is not securely latched and batteries pop out just enough that the remote doesn't work. The display is lit up and seems like it is functioning, but the fan doesn't respond. Once I push the batteries all the way back into place, everything works properly. I have to do this about 90% of the time I want to use the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Allan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Timer/Thermostat for ceiling fan!
customer_reviews.text: Works great replaced the non timer/thermostatically controlled wireless switch with this one, works great. Temp reads at the switch not the fan which should be obvious. Timer works too so you can have it on when you go to sleep and turn off to prevent getting cold either using timer or thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: I love this product. Make sure the fan speed is on high with the pull chain
customer_reviews.text: Make sure the fan speed is on high before installing the module or you will find the three speeds this control are less than high speed. I eliminated the poll change after installing the module because I didn't want anybody to make the mistake of pulling it. I love this product what a difference it makes to have a brain controlling the fan. And if your house was not wired for separate switches for the light and fan this is an easy way of fixing that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Brady

customer_reviews.title: Coolest Remote Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Every ceiling fan should come with this!! It is absolutely awesome! We really love the thermostat feature. the fan comes on a shuts off all by itself at a set temp. Works great for the upstairs bedroom that gets warm. Fairly easy to install just make sure there is room for the receiver, mine was a really tight fit and a bit of a challenge to get in. But well worth the effort!
customer_reviews.author: Cj

customer_reviews.title: A great thermostat fan control but it is not designed to dim LED bulbs.
customer_reviews.text: Product works as advertised but it does not work well with dimming LEDs. The dimming circuit in this controller is designed to work with incandescent lamps and will cause flickering during dimming when used with LEDs. As long as you use the light at 100% it will work fine, I tested with several different LED brands with the same results. The main reason I purchased this product was for the automatic thermostat control of the fan and it works as I expected. Review knocked to 4 stars for no mention of LED incompatibility.
customer_reviews.author: Devilz

customer_reviews.title: Item not as shown!
customer_reviews.text: The item I received had a remote that did not have an LCD screen. Unfortunately, I just handed the handyman the closed box to install and did not realize the issue until after it was installed. It works just fine, but one of the reasons I bought this particular remote kit was for the screen that gives you information. I'm not happy.
customer_reviews.author: T. Scruggs

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, works great.
customer_reviews.text: Really like the light delay function and the fact that the dimmer goes to 20%. I am using it with dimmable LEDs and it works great. Being able to time the lighting is a nice feature as well. It installed easily and works great. I bought this to replace a crappy remote that came with the fan and didn't last a week. I am using it to control a central fan and a chandelier located across the room. Works great. Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce E. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Dims LED Bulbs With No Problems
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Exact replacement, at least functionality wise, as my old Harbor Breeze controller that wouldn't turn off the light anymore. The best part is that the old remote works with the new brain so I have two remotes, one on either side of the master bed, to control the lights. Also dims great with the Eco Smart LED 40 Watt Candelabra bulbs from Home Depot!
customer_reviews.author: caesura

customer_reviews.title: I hesitate to purchase this .
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry, but this unit just didn't work. very very disappointed . did everything right, very simple to install. codes were both then same but nothing. buzzed it out and nothing. came out of the blue or black wires after power was applied. Now did I just happen to get a bad one? maybe! but quite franky if the company stood by there product they would have said don't return it to the store call us if you have a problem. there is NOTHING! given.
customer_reviews.author: R. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new Hunter fan that did NOT have a remote. Bought this unit and installed it with original installation of fan. Simple. The wiring instructions were explicit and simple. The receiver unit fit perfectly inside the canopy that fits against the ceiling. I used a long tie wrap to keep it in place inside the bracket. I have already referred other friends to this product. Highly recommended. BTW, it has a timer for the light and for the fan...PLUS you can also set the temperature and the fan turns on/off and changes speed based on variance of room temp from temp you set.
customer_reviews.author: BobG

customer_reviews.title: Easily breakable remote; requires dimmable bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install in a properly installed ceiling fan. However, the remote control wall mount is hit or miss... When I missed, the remote fell on the hardwood floor, broke apart, and cracked the screen. I couldn't find a replacement remote, so I had to buy a whole new kit to replace the remote that broke within 15 minutes of installing the system. Note that this system has a dimmer for the lights, so I had to switch my bulbs out from compact florescents to ones that support dimming to avoid damaging the bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Don M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Love the thermostat control. Battery door poor design though
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Love the thermostat control, it raises fan from LOW->Med->High as temp gets hotter, and you can put the remote thermostat anywhere in the room. Problem though: Battery door won't stay closed and keeps popping open with batteries falling out. Tape can't hold it on either, it still pops open with a lot of pressure from the batteries. Plastic door is poorly molded and doesn't have good clip design to stay closed. I superglued it shut!!! Hopefully that will work. I will unscrew it to change the batteries every 2 years I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Works well after seller replaced the remote
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Returned defective remote and it was replaced by the seller. Now 5 stars! **************** Everything works as advertised except that our remote has a bad temperature sensor. It shows that the room temp is ALWAYS 77 degrees. Just to make sure, I put the remote in the refrigerator overnight, and it still shows 77 degrees, even with new batteries. I will update this review to 5 stars if if the seller can swap out my remote. I certainly don't want to have to uninstall the whole control unit, just so send it back Amazon style.
customer_reviews.author: D Higby

customer_reviews.title: It worked for a few days
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two of these. The one i installed over 6 months ago and it works well. Installation can be difficult depending on the amount of space inside the housing. The second one worked a few days, then stopped working. The amazon return process is terrific.
customer_reviews.author: Rudolph E Anduze Jr

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for converting an old Hampton bay pull chain ceiling fan we got used and painted up. So nifty as my husband installed it above our staircase so it would be impossible to use with the pull chain.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe

customer_reviews.title: Finally a thermostat retrofit for most ceiling fans.
customer_reviews.text: This unit can be used to control virtually any ceiling fan that has enough room in the motor base or in the escutcheon to hold the receiver unit. The remote can be used for both lights and fan or just fan. One thing to note is that this thermostat will not turn on a fan or turn off a fan at a preset temperature. It will only reduce the fan speed to the lowest setting once it reaches within 2 degrees of the desired temp.
customer_reviews.author: G.Quinton

customer_reviews.title: Great buy if you need a replacement remote. I haven't used the receiver.
customer_reviews.text: This saved me somewhere between 30 and 130 dollars. It works great with my model. I didn't need the receiver, only the remote and most of the remotes that I priced were overpriced (in my opinion). This was cheaper than some of the single remotes. I got this, swapped with my remote and stored the receiver away in case I ever need it.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Works Just Like The Original
customer_reviews.text: First I'd like to say the dimmer on my unit does work by depressing and holding the yellow button (I've read so many reviews to the contrary). I think a workable dimmer depends on the model of universal remote received. I read some remotes were stamped "Flow Angel". My remote does not contain any logo. The model number embossed on the rear panel is "FAN-9T", exactly the same as the Hampton Bay remote this one replaces. All other aspects of this remote work exactly as it did on the replaced Hampton Bay remote. The seller of my remote (at Amazon.com) was Ceiling Fan Controls Megamart, for those that are looking for light dimmer control capability.
customer_reviews.author: Carl J...

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as specified. No complaints except that remote is not intergangable with any other units in my house and no other remotes fully functional with this receiver. So don't by thinking you're going to split it up.
customer_reviews.author: c s

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: We won't use all the features; just wanted a remote fan control, and it does a good job of that. Installation in flush mount meant limited space, so used zip ties to make a harness and another to attach it to an existing wiring clamp. Leads a couple of inches longer would have helped
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: The buttons stick.
customer_reviews.text: It almost always takes several pressing of a button for it to work. Also sometimes the buttons will stick in the "on" position. I have 3 of them all of them have the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: JMFR

customer_reviews.title: Slightly better than a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.text: works as advertised. exactly like the other one I have from different manufacturer. Guess they are all just rebranded. Biggest complaint is that there is no UP/DOWN for light control. You have to hold the button and the light will cycle up and down through all of the brightness levels (80 to be exact) until you get to the light level you are looking for. Super dumb. Oh yeah, the battery cover doesn't stay on. Doesn't matter which 'brand' you buy. Inherent design flaw. And when the battery cover comes loose, (which it will) the batteries fall out. Also, super dumb.
customer_reviews.author: turbogeek

customer_reviews.title: Great Product For The Price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because the existing controller had failed after several years. Installation was the same as other controllers and it worked as intended when installed. The only problem I'm having is that sometimes the fan gets out of sync with the controller, particularlly if you change speeds to quickly. If the remote didn't have a display of the fan speed, one would have no idea that it was out of sync and would just keep pushing the button until one obtained the desired result. It will generally re-sync by cycling through the speeds or by turning the fan off at the switch and cycling the remote to off and then switching the fan on again at the switch.
customer_reviews.author: James Robert Black

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I installed this into an existing fan in under 30 minutes. Everything was easy to install and well marked. I'd recommend using name brand batteries for it. The brand-new generic ones I tried to use kept giving a low battery warning.
customer_reviews.author: Don K

customer_reviews.title: these are great. Lots of options for fan speed
customer_reviews.text: I did not install, so can't attest to simplicity of install, but in terms of use, these are great. Lots of options for fan speed, etc, yet still easy to use. I did two of these and mounted them right next to the wall switch. You can pull out the remote and take it with you, to turn off the fan from bed w/o getting up. They work well and were much less than the recommended brand. FWIW my electrician said these work with pretty much all ceiling fans, even the ones that claim you need their brand.
customer_reviews.author: Chris in Denver

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but it could use night time illumination of buttons
customer_reviews.text: I like this fan speed controller, but it could be made even better, by adding button illumination. That would be very useful, when adjusting the fan speed, in a dark room. I have a remote that controls the angle of my bed, which illuminates the buttons, when any one of them is pressed. It'd be great, if the manufacture of this remote, could do something similar.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Can't be happier!  :)
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Had an older version of this remote that wasn't compatible with the new LED lights. The original one was about 10 years old and still worked fine but it was time to switch to LEDs. I love the temperature sensor on this because you can set it to Auto and it will change the fan speed based on the temperature in the room. (It will even turn it off as well.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... it is supposed to do and for that I like it. However
customer_reviews.text: It seems to do what it is supposed to do and for that I like it. However, I didn't get around to installing it until 3 or so months after purchase and when I did, part of the screen doesn't work (see image). So, I'm not sure the quality is going to be that great.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Haas

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over a year and it works great! The remote is a little large so be sure it fits. I bought two and it saves you from getting up and pulling chains or flipping wall switches. The timer is a great feature and will shut off when you wish. For ceiling fans only.
customer_reviews.author: Narlothep

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt last long
customer_reviews.text: We bought this on May 25, 2019 so we would not have to get out of bed when our newborn arrived. Then one day my husband went to turn on the lights and nothing happened. The fan and the lights did not work. Finally a few weeks later when we had the chance to fix it while babe was sleeping we checked everything and ended up removing the hardware and our fan worked fine. I haven't contacted the seller yet to see if I can have an exchange or refund bit I will update this post.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install-Works like a Charm!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic purchase! My daughter-in-law installed it with the new fan I also purchased from Amazon, the Hunter 53091 Builder Deluxe. It fit in the fan perfectly and works like a charm. I use it in my bedroom, on the manual function. I don't use the thermostat control. It installed quickly and worked right away. I have been using it for a week and no problems. My fan is connected to a light switch on the wall, so I use the switch to turn the fan off and on when I leave or enter the bedroom. Highly recommend this item. The Hunter 53091 is a terrific fan as well. Easy install and is very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: JMS

customer_reviews.title: it's nice to be able to set the temp
customer_reviews.text: Works well. With it being in the bedroom, it's nice to be able to set the temp, so that it turns off, if it drops too low while sleeping. Timer function for fan and light could be useful, too...I just don't really have a need for those. If you have kids or adults who forget to turn the fan off, the timer / temp function could save you some money (just remember, that when the temp goes above the set temp, it will turn on again, automatically, unless you have turned it off).
customer_reviews.author: Coastal Rob

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: The buttons are a bit small and it hard to guess correct button in dark room. Will probably get it with practice. Wish it had glow in dark or light but otherwise works as promised.
customer_reviews.author: CindyLuke

customer_reviews.title: Great Fan Remote
customer_reviews.text: Love this remote. I didn't think I'd use the automatic temperature setting but I immediately found it useful. This remote was $10 cheaper than any fan remote at Home Depot and it has more features. Would've given this 5 stars, but the battery compartment has opened up twice on its own since I've had the remote.
customer_reviews.author: C.D.

customer_reviews.title: Good controller with timer.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good controller and used for 3months now. Install is easy. Fit hunter fan. Its high medium and low settings can be combined with fan high mid low speed settings. As a results you can get slower fan speed to let fan run overnight . The temperature measurements are several degrees off from the real temperature. It woukd be greater if they put a backlight on the controller. Otherwise, I have to turn on ceiling fan light to check and change the remote settings.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and working well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the ceiling fan remote in my office that stopped working. Was an easy swap out and wiring. The only issue was needing a larger cap for the wires to the house. But, I'm glad to not have to mess with dangling cords for a 12' ceiling fan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Installed in existing fan in just under two hours including replacement of wall dimmer with standard switch. In new construction it would only add a few minutes to a fan installation. Future improvement would be some kind of mounting bracket for the receiver. I have a ceiling hugger fan and had to use double faced tape to stick the receiver to the ceiling. Fortunately the unit is small enough to fit beneath the canopy on my Hunter brand fan. Not sure what others are experiencing with the light dimmer feature, but on my unit holding the yellow button down does slowly lower and raise the lights (even though it does not explain it in the directions). So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: E. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Works great with the LED bulbs I installed on our ceiling fan
customer_reviews.text: Works good with our ceiling fan and with the new LED bulbs that I installed. Wish it had dedicated up and down buttons for the lighting. You have hold the one button down and it will dim and when it reaches the lowest setting it'll start to raise the lighting level. When it gets to the highest setting it'll turn around and start dimming again. I would still buy another one if I had to.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Controller with automatic thermostat fan control
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older unit which looked exactly like this. The new unit is much more responsive to button presses compared to the original. The old unit lasted about 6 years, let's see how long this one lasts. I will update the review if there are any problems.
customer_reviews.author: ekerry

customer_reviews.title: Easy, affordable, remote has options to operate fan.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to install, just enough room for reciever In pictured fan . don't forget to change the d. i. p. switches in fan reciever and remote so the new remote won't operate other fans if you have any other fans with similar remote&/receiver.
customer_reviews.author: louis

customer_reviews.title: This universal works amazingly and it has so many wonderful features that it was almost worth him destroying the ...
customer_reviews.text: My son put our old fan remote in a place above the fireplace so that it melted. This universal works amazingly and it has so many wonderful features that it was almost worth him destroying the old one (which basically just had on and off). This was so easy to set up and I love the temperature options.
customer_reviews.author: CrysD724

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy For Our Needs
customer_reviews.text: This is actually our second one. The original stopped working after about 14 years. When it gets towards the end of its life, you'll know because the lights will come on all by themselves and flash off. It's easy to install and use. I keep the fan at a medium setting with it only turning on if the room temp hits 70 degrees during the summer months. I also like that it tells me the temp of my room at all times. It's a little more expensive than some on the market, but well worth the cost for reliability, ease of installation and user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: The Three Woods

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine-  but failed after two years.
customer_reviews.text: Really good product so far. Requires 4 batteries which is only down side so far. Temperature settings are nice and was pretty easy to install. Update may 2019- Electronics failed after two years. It’s too difficult to install for it only last two years. I’ve dropped it from four stars down to three stars.
customer_reviews.author: mpv

customer_reviews.title: Why haven't I heard about these earlier!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a solution to my problem with having to pull chains on the fan and decided to give this a try. Beside disassembling and reassembling the fan, installation and wiring couldn't be more straight forward and easy. Works great and now I can lay in bed, dim the lights, see the room temp, set my desired temp to adjust fan speed, and even set a timer to turn off automatically. For how inexpensive it is, why wouldn't you?
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: The unit is fairly priced and it's way better than the stock Hampton bay remote
customer_reviews.text: This remote shows the room temp and you can set a desired room temp. The unit is fairly priced and it's way better than the stock Hampton bay remote. The only thing they could design better is to have more flexibility on the light and fan timer. You get 3 minutes or 30 minute increments.
customer_reviews.author: nat

customer_reviews.title: Surprised how well this works. I installed on a ...
customer_reviews.text: Surprised how well this works. I installed on a basic pull chain fan/light combo. I don't know how it works but pull chain until fan speed is on high and the remote can change the speed without ever needing to pull the chain again. I have the fan mounted in a high vaulted ceiling and cannot reach chains without a ladder so this was a must.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Schutt

customer_reviews.title: Perfecto
customer_reviews.text: I bought a nice Hampton bay ceiling fan without a remote control. After playing with the strings to control the fan and lights for a few days, I got sick of them and decided to find a better solution. I found this universal remote kit on Amazon. It worked perfect as described after I spent about 1/2 hour to install it. One exception is the dimming feature which I don't use because my light kit doesn't support it.
customer_reviews.author: GreatBuyer

customer_reviews.title: highly effective and would recommend. synced easily with the fan and the remote ...
customer_reviews.text: connected to all the fans in my house. highly effective and would recommend. synced easily with the fan and the remote works from a great distance away. has an auto temperature regulator so you can set the fan to the desired temp and it automatically runs at the correct speed for what you are trying to achieve. makes it easier than constantly having to check and change your fan settings.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Best Fan Remote on the Market
customer_reviews.text: We are extremely pleased with this remote. With the thermostat, goes off and on automatically--saving us a lot of money on electricity. It was very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S

customer_reviews.title: Handy item, nice functions
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing. It works. I have 11 foot ceilings in 3 rooms and it makes using the ceiling fans easier. I like the room temperature function (you choose a temperature and if it exceeds that, the fan comes on at the appropriate speed to reduce the temp). My only con is that it is big and ugly when attached to the wall, and it is just another remote control on an end table if you don't attach it. If I had seen the controls that fit in the switch box before I bought this, I might have gotten them, although they have fewer functions.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time, exact replacement
customer_reviews.text: Exact replacement for my old hunter ceiling fan's faulty receiver+remote pair. I replaced my old receiver+remote with this pair and my fan started working again!
customer_reviews.author: Emeka Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement part, works great
customer_reviews.text: Replaced in a fan, could not find locally, better than what was available at the local big box stores, less expensive and better features. Similar to an item Hampton Bay used to sell about 10-13 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable...Poor longevity
customer_reviews.text: This remote works "sometimes"!! As time went on, it's function started to decrease and finally I couldn't turn on the light at all with the remote. It's receiver is a little big, and more of a challenge to fit in the ceiling. I would not recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: A. H

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic remote
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It has a thermostat so you can set the fan to turn on at desired temperature. The fan speed control also works flawlessly. The only thing I miss is that there's no dimmer control for the light. But it does have an on/off switch for the light. Easy to install with initial installation of fan. Would buy again in a second.
customer_reviews.author: Chetti

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great with the Honeywell Ceiling Fan!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great with the Honeywell ceiling fan with light! Easy install. Came fast.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for maintaining our room atmosphere.
customer_reviews.text: Love this item, it was fairly easy to install and understand. The features of the remote and fan combination have given us exactly what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product at a brilliant price
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered and installed 2 of these and they work brilliantly. The features include: on and off lights 3 speeds for the fan timer to turn lights off timer to turn fan off settings on fans to maintain a particular temperature Installation was super easy with the included instructions, and I set the dip switches so each fan is controlled by its own remote. My only sad note is that I put them in the house that I am selling and I won't get to use them after I move out.
customer_reviews.author: A Family Effort

customer_reviews.title: Thermostatic ceiling fan and light controller
customer_reviews.text: Update Jan. 2015, unit sill living up to my expectations... I bought this unit to replace a major manufacturers controller, that would turn my fan and lights on, whenever it felt it should. I have to say that after two months of ownership, this controller has been flawless. Only took me 15 minutes to install, as I replaced another existing remote controller. On other reviews of this product, I noticed others were saying that the unit does not dim the lights... if you hold the light button down, it WILL dim your lights to your specific needs. Overall, I'm very satisfied with this controller.
customer_reviews.author: olzracer

customer_reviews.title: Great price & works well
customer_reviews.text: The product works very well and is priced very well. There's a MAJOR hardware retailer that sells the exact same unit (but with a nationally known brand name affixed) for almost twice the price!
customer_reviews.author: J. Maroney

customer_reviews.title: The only thing keeping me from giving it 5 out 5 is the bulky design Otherwise great. Love the fan speed control by temperature
customer_reviews.text: 201704 Have had it few weeks. Works as expected. I have 3 of these already. The only thing keeping me from giving it 5 out 5 is the bulky design Otherwise great. Love the fan speed control by temperature, time function, and light out delay Would be great with a clock in it too.
customer_reviews.author: Samie

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and buy this if your remote control goes out!
customer_reviews.text: The other remote controls are super expensive--ouch! If yours die, and they will eventually, buy this one even if you just need the remote and not the conversion kit. We bought two to use with the Hunter Fan in our bedroom and hung one by the door (they come with a little sleeve that you can attach to the wall) and we use it as a "on/off switch" and keep the other by the bed. They are great! You do have to be able to do a little electrical to put it in but they are working well and we'll buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Marcroft

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I can't imagine using a ceiling fan without these thermostatic remotes. Just set desired temp and the remote adjusts the fan speed or turns off according to the room temp. I haven't used the timer function.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Best ceiling fan invention ever!
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe I've never seen this type of product before until now, this has changed my life! Turned my little $20 ceiling fan into a $80 fan with remote and more! Having a thermostat built into my ceiling fan has made such a big difference with the temp of my small studio apartment but also my power bill, i like the fact i know my fan isn't running 24/7 when my place is cooled to what i want and doesn't need to be running fun blast all day.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a brown contractor's box with no instructions, however, there are plenty of YouTube instructions for installation.This fit inside my small ceiling-hugger fan with no problem. The remote does the job I needed it to do--give lighting and fan options on a single wall switch. The dimmer does not work with fluorescent bulbs, and it's better to keep the lighting at 80% rather than 100% if you do use fluorescent. I have not figured out how to program the thermostat but I'm sure other uses have. This has been in use since March.
customer_reviews.author: Gellie

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The battery cover though, needs to be taped in place.
customer_reviews.author: E. Shepard

customer_reviews.title: Exact replica at a much better price
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the original remotes that came with the Hunter fan with an exact copy of this one that I bought at Home depot 12 years ago. The control module that goes inside the fan base quit working. Went back to home depot and they did not have anything like this one and the ones they did have were a lot more expensive than this one. Ordered it, replaced the old one, it was a pain. the older fans do not have the little helpful things to hang a fan. It works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: P. M. Leon

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: For the motor settings, no problems: High, Medium, Low, Off. The Hampton Bay ceiling fan that I bought came with 4 'dimmable' CFL bulbs. They're not. CFLs haven't reached 'dimmable' like incandescent bulbs. The remote probably does reduce the time that the A/C is applied to the bulb. But all I see is the CFL getting *brighter* as a go from 100% to 80%, then the bulb begins to dim slightly, then it's off. If you're getting this remote, prepare to use incandescent bulbs in your ceiling fan.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Semel

customer_reviews.title: Mostly works, sometimes quirky behavior.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the fan will suddenly turn on even though the fan is set for manual operation. Occasionally turning on the light will start the fan too. I am not too confident in the longevity of this controller, which was used to replace a similar one that had failed (I actually bought this one because it had a similar looking remote, but wasn't compatible with the old unit.)
customer_reviews.author: T. Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Fans working again.
customer_reviews.text: Works great Easy install Be nice if remote would lite up for easier viewing
customer_reviews.author: Steve H

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the same as pictured
customer_reviews.text: The photos for this product show a remote which looks very similar to the Hampton Bay remote we're replacing. When it arrived, it had a big ugly logo on the bottom half of the remote. Otherwise, it's the same. The remote has a temperature readout which is off by a few degrees. Also, the receiver is slightly thicker than the stock Hampton Bay receiver it replaced. It didn't fit in our fan until we adjusted the mounting bracket. It might have been more trouble than it's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Joe and Catie Zeichman

customer_reviews.title: Prefect fit
customer_reviews.text: Replaced existing fan remote & transmitter. As someone mentioned before, it does work with reverse fan as well. My Fan has a switch on the fan for forward or reverse. So I had no problem, in future ever switching between modes. NOTE:- Remote needs 4 AAA cells.(not included) Default Temp reading is F, with a push of button switches to C if needed (back side of remote) 100% happy will recommend to everyone, only time will tell how durable it is. Home Depot sell simple one for 10X the cost.
customer_reviews.author: JAS

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for replacement fan controller
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace the controller for an older fan. This one fit into the same space inside the mounting and worked perfectly when installed. One key feature not mentioned is that, unlike the cheaper controllers, this one remembers the setting when powered off. So you can use your wall light switch to turn the light on and off. With my previous controller, I had to use the remote to turn the light on if I used the light switch to turn the unit off. Apparently it doesn't dim the lights (or I just haven't figured out how yet).
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Engstrom

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: Works like a dream, even has an auto feature that adjusts the speed of the fan as the temp changes at night. Can not address the battery usage yet as it is still to new. Will updae my review if that becomes an issue. Previous units I was replacing the battery every 6 months
customer_reviews.author: spitfireforbas

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Didn’t want to bother taking it apart and ...
customer_reviews.text: We installed the kit in the fan, however the remote that came with it doesn’t work. Very disappointed. Didn’t want to bother taking it apart and sending it back because the old remote worked with it. Still feel I lost money on paying for a remote that doesn’t work. Will not order again.
customer_reviews.author: Y F

customer_reviews.title: But it's fine otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: It works. Just doesn't have a reverse function for the fan. And the light is irritating because you have to hold it down and go all the way to 100% before you can dim it again. But it's fine otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: DahliaRose

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Ceiling fan controller replacement with handy features
customer_reviews.text: Built well, quality product, good instructions, great replacement for standard controller. There are many features, the one i find most useful is the percentage scale of light output. With standard controllers you never know until you've gone past it and it start to dim that you were at full light intensity
customer_reviews.author: Wycombe

customer_reviews.title: Remote works with my existing fan setup. didn't need ...
customer_reviews.text: Remote works with my existing fan setup. didn't need to change the receiver, just mathced the dip switches on both. mine looked exactly the same but branded "Hampton Bay" The new one came in, looked exactly the same, but branded "Flow Angel"
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Helps to view on youtube for non experts.
customer_reviews.text: All went well on installation. Reviewed first on youtube for installation. Installed on a older fan. Works great
customer_reviews.author: Abel T Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. I thought the thermostat control to be silly at first but it really works well for nights that are hot and mornings that are cool. The fan shuts off automatically in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Claxton

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 2 hours of use. Poor packaging. Shipped in envelope.
customer_reviews.text: This ceiling fan and light controller worked for 2 hours, then started to intermittently fail. Sometimes it would work, sometimes it would not. I tried over a dozen different code variation with no success. It was probably due to being shipped in an envelope with little to no protection. It should have been shipped in a box.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Van Hoose

customer_reviews.title: Great remote
customer_reviews.text: Great remote for less money than anything in the stores. I had a fan with a factory remote like this in my last house. I loved the temp. setting factor. So when I saw this remote I went for it. I installed a new fan with this remote two days ago. It was simple to hook up,the sending unit tucks away nicely in the fan mount. Been using it 2 days and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: arthur v.

customer_reviews.title: Great find
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been great! Love the timer feature and the temp feature for controlling an old fan that we have. I plan on buying more as needed. Upgrade your old fans and make them work like the new ones with all the bells and whistles OR more!
customer_reviews.author: TnT

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: it stopped working after 6 months of use. Remote display still seems to work, but light and and fan is stuck on a position and it won’t change. There is no warranty from the seller. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: hrshfjsw

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: relatively easy install, only one issue.... the sticky tape didn't hold the device the first time. I had to take the fan apart and apply more sticky tape and wire it inplace. As far as functionality, and convenience, thumbs up. I ordered a second one for another room. I'll probably use twist ties in addition to the tape next go round, just in case. I would and did buy again.
customer_reviews.author: steve johnson

customer_reviews.title: Love these, I had some on my fans for ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these, I had some on my fans for the past 12 years. I bought new fans and these to replace my old worn out ones, these are even better than the ones I had.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Not dependable stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I had the unit installed by an electrician and it quit working after a month. The remote control unit works but the control unit on the fan is out. I've change batteries on the remote and tried pressing several different buttons. Lots of people may buy this but it's cheep crap....
customer_reviews.author: Carl Short

customer_reviews.title: This unit sucks! Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This unit sucks! Do not buy. I am not a petty buyer or reviewer complaining for no reason. 1. This unit remote will never go into sleep mode, meaning the screen is on all the time, putting a large drain on your batteries. Due to the drain, your batteries will more than likely fail and leak, your unit will stop working and you will have to buy a new one. You might say, I used subpar batteries. We blew thru both Duracell and energizer batteries and now the unit doesn't function at all. Best of luck on your but
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Olson

customer_reviews.title: Nice little add-on remote control
customer_reviews.text: Nice little add-on remote control. Has decent features like an LCD readout, and the ability to control the fan by either a built-in timer, or built-in thermometer. The remote module is on the large side, and may not fit all fans. It goes above the ball mount on the end of the downrod, tucked in the bracket that actually screws to the ceiling. So make sure you have enough room, or the fan's decorative cover won't fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nonymous

customer_reviews.title: Nice display and does work but requires multable try’s to ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice display and does work but requires multable try’s to control light and fan Would not recommend even though costs more than the cheap controls and presented as “better”
customer_reviews.author: Edward Tweed

product_meta.title: Universal Thermostatic Ceiling Fan and Light Remote Control Conversion Kit
product_meta.description: The product can be applied to any regular ceiling fan and is easy to install with the enclosed instruction manual following step by step. It is UL licensed and meets all safety requirement. The transmitter could either be wall mounted or hand-held for easy access.
feature_bullets: This kit converts regular ceiling fan into a remote controllable one.
This remote control is designed to separately control your ceiling fan speed and light.
The screen displays HI, MED, LOW, OFF modes to control the fan speed and off.
It has both fan and light timer button to program the fan and light.
The thermostatic button on the transmitter will automatically set fan when press.

specifications.Special Features: Adjustable Speed Control, Countdown Timer, Automatic Shut-Off, Programmable, Thermal
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars730 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
